text: hi I'm Melissa Clark from the dining
section
do you love ordering calamari and
restaurants but does it kind of creep
you out to cook it at home when you're
shopping for squid make sure to buy the
whole squid bodies and not the kind that
have already been cut up into rings
those are usually a lot tougher
in fact sometimes they're not even squid
so when you get your squid home you're
going to notice that the bodies will
have probably been separated from the
tentacles that's fine and what you want
to do is give everything a really good
rinse make sure to get in the bodies
make sure that there's no sand in there
and then spread it out on a paper towel
line tray and let it dry for a little
while the drier your squid the better
it'll cook most recipes are going to
call for you to cut the squid bodies up
into rings so to do that just take your
squid lay it on a cutting board and
slice it into half-inch rings then to
cut up the tentacles if you've got big
ones something like that
this is a 2-byte tentacle you want to
cut it in half then if there's also some
small tentacles in the mix you can just
leave them as is you don't have to do
anything to them so when you got your
squid I'll cut up just Pat it super dry
with a paper towel like I said the drier
your squid the faster and better it will
cook get your pan really hot let the
flame just sit under it for about two
minutes
add your oil just a thin layer on the
bottom of the pan and then you want to
add your squid and make sure you're
wearing something splatter proof because
it's going to hiss
careful not to overcrowd your pan the
squid needs room to move around now
here's the hard part once you've got the
squid in the pan and you've separated it
all out don't touch it for a full minute
see that nice color on it that nice
color is because the pan was hot enough
and you dried the squid really well if
you want to add garlic or chillies to
the pan you can go ahead and add it
along with the squid at the same time
the trick to cooking squid is not to
overcrowd the pan you can add a little
greenery for color then serve it to your
family and call it calamari
